sen.j: 慈円（じえん、久寿2年4月15日 (旧暦)（1155年5月17日） - 嘉禄元年9月25日 (旧暦)（1225年10月28日））は、歴史書『愚管抄』で有名な鎌倉時代の天台宗僧侶である。
sen.e: Jien (April 15th in 1155 (old lunar calendar) (May 17th in 1155) - September 25th in 1225 (old lunar calendar) (October 28th in 1225)) was a priest of Tendai sect in Kamakura Period, who was famous for a history book,"Gukansho."
Jien (May 17, 1155 - October 28, 1225) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the Kamakura period and was famous for the history book, "Gukansho."
Jien (May 17, 1155 - October 28, 1225) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the Kamakura period and was famous for the history book, "Gukansho."

sen.j: 諡号は慈鎮和尚で一般に吉水僧正とも呼ばれ、また小倉百人一首では、前大僧正慈円と称されている。
sen.e: Shigo, posthumous name (based the deeds one has performed in their lifetime) was Jichin Osho and generally called Yoshimizu Sojo, and in Ogura Hyakunin Isshu he was called Saki-no-Daisojo Jien (Former High Priest JIEN).

Shigo, posthumous name (based the deeds one has performed in their lifetime) was Jichin Osho and generally called Yoshimizu Sojo, and in Ogura Hyakunin Isshu he was called Saki-no-Daisojo Jien (Former High Priest JIEN).

Shigo, posthumous name (based the deeds one has performed in their lifetime) was Jichin Osho and generally called Yoshimizu Sojo, and in Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets) he was called Saki-no-Daisojo Jien (Former High Priest JIEN).
sen.cmt: 小倉百人一首を (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets)としました。

sen.j: 慈円は藤原忠通と加賀局（藤原仲光の娘）の子で忠通の第六子、九条兼実の弟。
sen.e: Jien was a child between FUJIWARA no Tadamichi and Kaga-no-tsubone (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu), and a younger brother of Kanezane KUJO, the sixth child of Tadamichi.
Jien was the child of FUJIWARA no Tadamichi and Kaga-no-tsubone (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu) and a younger brother of Kanezane KUJO, the sixth child of Tadamichi.
Jien was the child of FUJIWARA no Tadamichi and Kaga-no-tsubone (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu) and a younger brother of Kanezane KUJO, the sixth child of Tadamichi.

sen.j: 幼いときに青蓮院に入寺し、1167年（仁安 (日本)2年）天台座主明雲について受戒。
sen.e: He entered in Shorenin Temple in his childhood and was given vowing to follow the precepts by Myoin, the temple's head priest of Tendai sect in 1167.
He entered Shorenin Temple in his childhood, and in 1167 he was given vows to follow the precepts by Myoin, the temple's head priest of the Tendai sect.
He entered Shorenin Temple in his childhood, and in 1167 he was given vows to follow the precepts by Myoun, the temple's head priest of the Tendai sect.

sen.j: 1192年（建久2年）、38歳で天台座主になる。
sen.e: In 1192 he became the head priest of Tendai sect at the age of 38.
In 1192, at age 38, he became the head priest of the Tendai sect.
In 1192, at age 38, he became the head priest of the Tendai sect.

sen.j: その後慈円の天台座主就任は4度に及んだ。
sen.e: After that, he assumed the head priest of Tendai sect four times.
Subsequently, he assumed the head priest of Tendai sect four times.
Subsequently, he assumed the position of head priest of Tendai sect four times.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。 “he assumed the head priest”=>”he assumed the position of head priest”

sen.j: 天台座主として法会や伽藍の整備のほか、政治的には兼実の孫九条道家の後見人を務めるとともに、道家の子藤原頼経が将軍として鎌倉に下向することに期待を寄せるなど、公武の協調を理想とした。
sen.e: He held Buddhism mass and built temples as the head priest of Tendai sect, and politically he acted as a guardian for Michiie KUJO, a grandson of Kanezane, and expected that FUJIWARA no Yoritsune, a son of Michiie, went to Kamakura as Shogun, with having an ideal of cooperation betweenf imperial court and military government.

He held Buddhist mass and built temples as the head priest of the Tendai sect; politically, he acted as a guardian for Michiie KUJO (a grandson of Kanezane) and expected that FUJIWARA no Yoritsune (a son of Michiie) would go to Kamakura as the shogun, having the ideal of cooperation between the Imperial Court and the military government.

sen.j: また、当時異端視されていた専修念仏の法然や弟子の親鸞を庇護してもいる。
sen.e: In addition, he protected Honen in Senshu Nembutsu and his disciple, Shinran, who were regarded as heretical at that time.

Additionally, he protected Honen who advocated Senshu Nenbutsu (single-mindedly chanting Namu-amida-butsu, which means devoting oneself to Amida Buddha) and his disciple Shinran, who were regarded as heretics at that time.
sen.cmt: 「専修念仏の法然」を、Honen who advocated Senshu Nenbutsu (single-mindedly chanting Namu-amida-butsu, which means devoting oneself to Amida Buddha) としました。

sen.j: なお、親鸞は1181年9歳の時に慈円について得度を受けている。
sen.e: Moreover, Shinran entered priesthood by Jien at the age of 9 in 1181.
Moreover, Shinran entered the priesthood by Jien in 1181, at the age of 9.

sen.j: 歌人としても有名で家集に『拾玉集』があり、『千載和歌集』などに名が採り上げられている。
sen.e: He is also famous as Kajin, poet, and left a collection, "Shugyoku-shu," and his name is seen in "Senzai Waka-shu" and so on.
sen.cmt: 「家集」は「歌集」の誤記と判断しました。
sen.e: He is also famous as a kajin (poet) who left the collection "Shugyoku-shu," and his name is seen in "Senzai Waka-shu" and so on.
He is also famous as a kajin (poet) who left the collection "Shugyoku-shu," and his name is seen in "Senzai Waka-shu (Collection of a Thousand Years)" and so on.
sen.cmt: 千載和歌集に(Collection of a Thousand Years) と補足しました。

sen.j: 又、教科書にも出てくる越天楽今様の作詞者でもある。
sen.e: Besides, he was a lyric writer of Entenraku Imayo, which is seen in textbooks.
Moreover, he was the lyricist of Entenraku Imayo, which is seen in textbooks.
Moreover, he was the lyricist of Entenraku Imayo (a piece of Gagaku, traditional form of music in Japan), which is seen in textbooks.
